attributes.action: ensure local authorities set aside one third of city retail space for local businesses and halt the high street chain-store monopoly
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Chain stores are monopolising UK High Streets which are becoming increasingly indistinguishable from one another with the effect that cities are becoming clones with little diversity, interesting local flavour or the ability to cater to minority tastes.

Powers for local authorities to exclude chain stores (with three or more UK outlets already, say) from designated areas should be brought in to help re-invigorate city centres and give back a sense of ownership by encouraging local businesses to flourish.
